Composite front door with obscure glazed side panel leads to a beautifully presented and welcoming entrance hallway with understairs storage cupboard and door to ground floor cloakroom with obscure window overlooking side aspect. There are two further wooden glazed doors leading to the sitting room and kitchen/dining room. The sitting room benefits from an abundance of windows overlooking the front aspect creating a wonderfully bright living space with double opening doors leading to a thoughtfully modernised kitchen/dining/family room. The kitchen boasts an excellent range of quartz worktops with matching splashback and an excellent range of contemporary built in base cupboards and drawers with matching wall mounted units. Integrated appliances include a large electric range style cooker with fitted extractor over, dishwasher, wine cooler and eye level microwave oven. There is space for an American style fridge freezer with fitted pull out pantry cupboards either side. The breakfast bar gives good space for informal dining and there is a window overlooking rear aspect. The dining area has lots of space for a large dining table and there are impressive contemporary sliding patio doors leading to rear garden. A door leads through into the utility room which has plenty of fitted storage cupboards and space and plumbing for the washing machine and tumble drier with window overlooking rear aspect. This room also provides space and storage for coats with further cupboard housing Worcester gas fired central heating boiler. Stairs from entrance hallway lead to a good sized first floor landing with window overlooking side aspect with double airing cupboards with slatted shelving and wood panelled balustrade. There are three double bedrooms all benefitting from built in wardrobes, the third bedroom currently overlooks the front aspect with the second bedroom overlooking the rear garden. The second bedroom also benefits from large eaves storage space. Bedrooms two and three are serviced by the beautifully appointed main bathroom with stunning separate shower unit with rainfall shower and superb freestanding bath with handheld shower, There is also a contemporary wash hand basin with wall mounted mirror above with led lighting built in and window overlooking rear aspect. The first floor accommodation is completed by the principal bedroom which provides an excellent range of built in wardrobes and a pocket sliding door leads to the beautiful en suite shower room with tiled flooring, large shower cubicle with rainfall shower and dual basins with wall mounted LED heated mirror. The rear garden has a superb raised patio terrace which is decked and spans across the rear of the property and around to the side providing multiple seating areas perfect for alfresco dining/ entertaining. The seating area to the side is enclosed contemporary horizontal slatted fencing with matching door providing side access whilst giving excellent privacy. The garden has been completely remodelled by the current vendor and it boasts raised beds with shrub and flower borders, a range of beautiful patio pathways and a wonderful area mostly laid to lawn. To the right hand side there is an area laid to shingle which has wooden storage shed and double opening wooden doors leading down to the front of the property. To the rear of the garden there are further beds with an excellent range of shrub and flowers with hedging and fencing enclosing the garden providing a good degree of privacy. You approach the property via electric double opening gates which lead into the spacious and attractive shingle driveway providing good off road parking, there is an area laid to lawn and further hedging providing good privacy from the road. The property also benefits from an attached garage which provides power and lighting and on the wall outside is an electric car charging point. EPC RATING: Current ~ C69 Potential ~ B83 COUNCIL TAX BAND: F SERVICES: HEATING:

Take the second right into Kivernell Road and proceed for a quarter of a mile turning right into New Valley Road. Take the first left into Sharvells Road and then first right into Sycamore Close and Little Brook will be found towards the end of the no through road on the right hand side. MILFORD AND THE LOCAL AREA Milford on Sea is a thriving coastal village with a comprehensive range of restaurants, pubs and cafes plus a good range of gift and local shops including a greengrocers, butchers and two general stores, plus a medical centre and dental surgery, based around the village green. The Village Green is home to several events during the year, including an Arts & Music Festival, May Fair, Dog Show and Christmas Carol Service, with the Community Centre and the four village churches running busy programmes throughout the year. Walks can be enjoyed along the Coastal Path towards Barton-on-Sea and Lymington, with stunning views towards the Isle of Wight and the Needles and westwards to Christchurch Bay, Hengistbury Head and the Purbeck Hills beyond or through sheltered woodland in the Milford-on-Sea Pleasure Grounds and Studland Common, both local Nature Reserves, or around Sturt Pond and along Hurst Shingle Bank to Hurst Castle which dates back to Tudor times. The New Forest National Park is a short drive away, The New Forest became a national park in 2005 and was once a royal hunting ground for William the Conqueror. It covers an area of 566 square kilometres and is made up of vast tracts of unspoilt woodland, heathland and river valleys where deer, ponies and cattle continue to roam free in its ancient heaths and woodland. Clear rivers and shady groves provide tranquillity and a car-free haven for walking, cycling and horse riding. The towns of Lymington and New Milton are both approximately 3 miles away, with the larger shopping centres of Bournemouth and Southampton approximately equi-distant, about 18 miles away. British Rail Stations at New Milton and Brockenhurst provide a fast service to London Waterloo, with Bournemouth and Southampton airports easily accessed for domestic and international flights. www.visitmilfordonsea.co.uk and www.milfordonsea.org are two excellent websites providing a wealth of local information and news about the village Stamp Duty charges and online calculator- www.gov.uk/stamp-duty-land-tax/residential-property-rates

THE WHITE HOUSE, BUILT IN 1901, WAS DESIGNED TO EMULATE A SHIP'S BRIDGE BY ROMAINE WALKER, A RENOWNED VICTORIAN ARCHITECT WHO ALSO WORKED ON OTHER NOTABLE BUILDINGS INCLUDING CHATSWORTH HOUSE, THE TATE GALLERY, WIMBORNE MINSTER AND LOCALLY, RHINEFIELD HOUSE IN BROCKENHURST. IT IS A WONDERFUL SNAPSHOT OF HISTORY AND WITH ITS STUNNING AND OUTSTANDING POSITION ON THE CLIFFTOPS OF MILFORD-ON-SEA, A STUNNING AND DESIRABLE PLACE TO LIVE The accommodation comprises (all measurements are approximate): Front door leading to: ENTRANCE HALL AND INTERNAL HALLWAY with ceramic tiled wood effect flooring, central heating radiators, wall light points, boiler cupboard, coats storage cupboard, linen cupboard, sky light windows and sealed unit double glazed port hole window with a view of the beach huts, seafront, Hurst Castle Spit and Solent approach beyond, door leading to: SITTING/DINING ROOM: 21'11" x 16' (6.68m x 4.88m) - superb ambient triple aspect room with sealed unit double glazed windows to the spectacular Needles, Isle of Wight and Solent approach vista, further sealed unit double glazed window to the easterly beach front and Hurst Castle aspect all with window seating, further sealed unit double glazed door and adjacent sidescreen overlooking and leading on to the internal communal White House grounds with a view of Bournemouth Bay and the Purbecks. MILFORD AND THE SURROUNDING AREA Milford on Sea is a thriving coastal village with a comprehensive range of restaurants, pubs and cafes plus a good range of gift and local shops including a greengrocers, butchers and two general stores, plus a medical centre and dental surgery, based around the village green. The Village Green is home to several events during the year, including an Arts & Music Festival, May Fair, Dog Show and Christmas Carol Service, with the Community Centre and the four village churches running busy programmes throughout the year. Walks can be enjoyed along the Coastal Path towards Barton-on-Sea and Lymington, with stunning views towards the Isle of Wight and the Needles and westwards to Christchurch Bay, Hengistbury Head and the Purbeck Hills beyond or through sheltered woodland in the Milford-on-Sea Pleasure Grounds and Studland Common, both local Nature Reserves, or around Sturt Pond and along Hurst Shingle Bank to Hurst Castle which dates back to Tudor times. The New Forest National Park is a short drive away, The New Forest became a national park in 2005 and was once a royal hunting ground for William the Conqueror. It covers an area of 566 square kilometres and is made up of vast tracts of unspoilt woodland, heathland and river valleys where deer, ponies and cattle continue to roam free in its ancient heaths and woodland. Clear rivers and shady groves provide tranquillity and a car-free haven for walking, cycling and horse riding. The towns of Lymington and New Milton are both approximately 3 miles away, with the larger shopping centres of Bournemouth and Southampton approximately equi-distant, about 18 miles away. National Rail Stations at New Milton and Brockenhurst provide a fast service to London Waterloo, with Bournemouth and Southampton airports easily accessed for domestic and international flights. www.visitmilfordonsea.co.uk and www.milfordonsea.org are two excellent websites providing a wealth of local information and news about the village Stamp Duty charges and online calculator- www.gov.uk/stamp-duty-land-tax/residential-property-rates

A canopy entrance porch opens to a spacious and welcoming hallway with stairs rising to the first floor, from the hallway the accommodation flows with a fully integrated kitchen/dining room, where a corner window creates a bright and airy space ideal for everyday living and entertaining. The sitting room is accessed from the hallway and features bi-fold doors opening directly onto the rear garden, enjoying a desirable south-westerly aspect. A Clearview wood-burning stove provides a charming focal point and adds warmth and character. The ground floor further benefits from a versatile study or fifth bedroom with double doors leading to the garden, a shower room with cloakroom facilities, and a practical utility room complimented by ample storage. An attractive turned staircase leads to the first-floor landing, which provides access to four bedrooms. The principal bedroom features built in wardrobes and an en-suite shower room, alongside a further double guest bedroom, a twin bedroom, and a single bedroom or study, all served by a separate family bathroom. Outside, the property is approached via an attractive private drive leading to a brick-paved driveway offering ample parking, with the remainder of the front garden laid to lawn and bordered by established planting. A side access leads to the rear garden, which features a generous paved terrace with automatic sunshine awing and a lawned area with steps descending to a rear gate. The garden is fully enclosed by fencing and mature trees and shrubs, and enjoys a sunny south-westerly aspect. Council Tax – F EPC Rating – C

Key Features • Rare 400-Year-Old Thatched Cottage with Newer Extension • Prime Brockenhurst Village Location • Full of Period Charm & Character • Four Bedrooms, Three Reception Rooms • Beautiful Gardens Front & Private to the Rear • Moments from Train Station & New Forest National Park • Private Driveway, Carport & Detached Garage • Scope for Flexible Living & Rental Potential The ground floor includes a family bathroom and a formal dining room, which flows seamlessly into a stunning open-plan living area, complete with parquet flooring, a beamed ceiling, and a wood burner. French doors open onto a tranquil rear garden oasis, inviting the outdoors in. At the heart of the home is a beautifully designed kitchen/breakfast room, featuring a marble-topped island and butler sink—ideal for both relaxed mornings and stylish entertaining. A striking cast iron spiral staircase, enclosed in a curved brick atrium, adds architectural intrigue as it leads to the first floor. Upstairs, the home continues to impress. The triple-aspect principal bedroom offers an abundance of natural light, joined by a generous guest room and a well-appointed family bathroom. Tucked into the thatched eaves, two further bedrooms provide a fairytale setting for family or guests. Outside, the enchantment continues. The front garden’s rose beds and white picket fence create a storybook welcome, while the secluded rear garden features mature trees, a serene pond, and a cedarwood summerhouse—perfect for peaceful retreats or summer entertaining. Behind tall timber gates, a gravel driveway leads to a spacious carport and detached garage, ensuring both privacy and practicality. Located just a short stroll from Brockenhurst train station with direct links to London Waterloo, and surrounded by the open beauty of the New Forest National Park, this is a once-in-a-generation opportunity to own an extraordinary period home in one of the South’s most desirable locations. Viewings are highly recommended to fully appreciate the timeless appeal and lifestyle this unique home has to offer

Hardstanding for shed. Covered log store.

An Exceptional Period Townhouse with Significant Development Potential in the Heart of Lymington This impressive and beautifully proportioned three-storey period townhouse offers approximately 1,500 sq ft of accommodation, complemented by a substantial adjoining outbuilding extending to circa 2,230 sq ft. Rarely does a property of such scale and versatility become available in this highly sought-after location. Positioned just a few hundred yards from Lymington’s historic Town Quay, the property enjoys close proximity to the river and its picturesque array of leisure and fishing boats. A foot passenger ferry provides convenient access to Yarmouth on the Isle of Wight, while the vibrant High Street is moments away, reached via a charming cobbled quay street lined with an excellent selection of boutique shops, renowned restaurants, and traditional public houses. The property benefits from extensive off-street parking to one side and offers outstanding potential for further enhancement. The adjoining outbuilding, previously utilised as offices and storage, presents a rare opportunity for redevelopment, subject to the usual consents. Potential uses include additional residential accommodation, a self-contained annexe, or a highly desirable live/work environment. The Main House The ground floor opens with a generous sitting room featuring a bay window overlooking Bath Road. Double doors lead through to an elegant dining room, enhanced by a feature wood-burning stove and staircase rising to the upper floors. The well-appointed kitchen/breakfast room is fitted with an extensive range of wall and base units, generous work surfaces, a double enamel sink, and space for a range cooker, creating a practical yet inviting space for everyday living and entertaining. The first floor hosts a principal bedroom to the front, enjoying a bay window and a spacious en-suite bathroom comprising a panelled bath, WC, wash basin, and a large separate shower cubicle, complemented by a charming Victorian fireplace. A second double bedroom is positioned to the rear together with a substantial shower room with WC, wash basin, and a large airing cupboard housing the hot water cylinder and boiler, also featuring a period fireplace. On the second floor, bedroom three is located to the front with its own en-suite shower room, while bedroom four benefits from an en-suite cloakroom. Steps lead to a generous attic space illuminated by two Velux windows, offering further scope and flexibility. The Outbuilding Adjoining the rear of the main house is the extensive two-storey outbuilding, currently arranged as a series of workshops and office spaces extending to 2230 sq ft. With its substantial footprint and adaptable layout, it presents an excellent opportunity for conversion to further accommodation or commercial use, subject to the necessary planning permissions. Summary A property of considerable character and scale, offering exceptional versatility in one of Lymington’s most desirable locations. Equally suited as a distinguished family residence, an investment opportunity, or a mixed residential and commercial proposition, this rare offering combines period elegance with outstanding potential. Council Tax – F EPC Rating - D

The ground floor accommodation is further complemented by a utility room and adjoining lobby, both providing convenient external access, as well as a cloakroom. To the first floor, a good-sized landing leads to all bedrooms. The principal bedroom benefits from a range of fitted wardrobes and a well-appointed en-suite shower room. There are three further generous bedrooms, served by a family bathroom. A particular feature of the property is the potential for a self-contained annexe, ideal for a dependent relative, guest accommodation, or home office. Located over the garage and accessed via a separate staircase, this area includes a large bed-sitting room, shower room, and its own independent access. Outside, the property enjoys a brick-paved driveway providing ample off-street parking for two to three vehicles, with additional space suitable for a dinghy or RIB. Double gates offer further access to the rear garden, which is of a good size for a modern development and benefits from a south-easterly aspect. The garden is laid predominantly to artificial lawn for ease of maintenance, enclosed by clearly defined fencing and enhanced by a mature oak tree. In our opinion, this is a particularly generous garden for a property of this type. The property is ideally positioned within Lymington, within easy reach of the vibrant High Street and the scenic Lymington River, renowned for its marinas, yacht clubs, and sailing facilities. The surrounding area offers an exceptional lifestyle, with the open spaces of the New Forest National Park close by, providing miles of walking, cycling, and riding across heathland and ancient woodland. Lymington’s excellent range of independent shops, cafés, restaurants, and weekly market, together with strong transport links and access to the Solent, combine to make this a highly desirable coastal and country location. Note: The potential annexe above the garage currently has a lodger paying £800 p/m. Council Tax – F EPC Rating - D

Entering through a bright and welcoming hallway, the home flows effortlessly into generously proportioned living spaces. The dual-aspect living room is bathed in natural light, featuring full-height glazing and French doors opening directly to the south-facing patio and garden. The impressive open-plan kitchen/dining room is fitted with sleek handleless cabinetry, quartz worktops and an island incorporating breakfast bar, creating an elegant and social hub for the home. Large windows and bi-fold doors ensure a bright, airy environment, ideal for both daily living and entertaining. The kitchen is equipped with a full range of premium NEFF integrated appliances, including: • Built-in double oven with modern touch-control interface • Induction hob for fast, efficient and precise cooking • Integrated dishwasher • Tall integrated fridge-freezer • Larder-style pantry cupboard A separate utility room provides valuable additional workspace and storage, with practical external access to the side and Neff Integrated washer-dryer. There are three generous double bedrooms, all finished in soft neutral tones. The principal bedroom benefits from a stylish en-suite shower room with a large glazed shower enclosure, modern tiling, chrome fixtures and an LED-lit mirror unit. The remaining bedrooms are served by a spacious family bathroom, featuring a quality shower-bath combination, contemporary tiling and a heated towel rail. The property features a high-efficiency Worcester Bosch boiler and a Solax Power photovoltaic inverter connected to the roof-mounted solar panels and is a key contributor to the property’s impressive A-rated performance. Outside The rear of the property enjoys a private, south-facing garden which is mostly laid to lawn and bordered by new close-board fencing. A full-width patio creates the perfect space for outdoor dining and relaxation. A brand-new timber shed provides useful garden storage. To the front, a wide gravel driveway offers excellent off-road parking, further enhanced by a substantial timber carport. EPC RATING: Current ~ A COUNCIL TAX BAND: TBC SERVICES: Mains water, electricity, gas and drainage. HEATING: Gas fired central heating. BROADBAND: Ultrafast up to 1000 mbps download (Ofcom).

The accommodation comprises (all measurements are approximate): Covered front entrance porch and outside light Front door leading to: ENTRANCE HALL - modern contemporary vertical radiator with central mirror feature, wall lights, storage cupboard and understairs UTILITY CUPBOARD housing a Siemens washer-dryer From the entrance hall, stairwell to the first floor, handrail with brushed aluminium finishings and knuckle joints, giving access to: Stunning FIRST FLOOR OPEN-PLAN LIVING SPACE - 21'2" into the door recess x 19'9" (6.45m x 6.02m) maximum measurements with maximum ceiling height of 10'10" (3.3m) - A living space that is full of light with a triple aspect and high ceiling giving a feeling of ambient calm whilst enjoying the panoramic vista from the Solent, Hurst Castle Spit, the Isle of Wight and the Needles to the east through to Hengistbury Head, Christchurch Bay and the Purbeck Hills in the west; further sealed-unit double-glazed window to the gated driveway approach with the adjacent communal lawns Living area - oak engineered flooring, wall lights, modern contemporary Italian vertical radiators with chrome fittings, TV aerial point, trap giving access to the roof space, double-glazed sealed unit doors and matching side screens leading onto: LARGE SOUTH-WEST FACING SUN TERRACE - 20'9" x 8'7" (6.32m x 2.62m) - timber decking and rendered wall parapet, providing a superb large relaxation/social area providing ample space for outside seating, BBQ equipment etc, with its outstanding coastal and sea views beyond the landscaped central gardens of The White House, with the terrace benefiting from a southerly aspect, offering outstanding all-day, bright, sunny views Kitchen area - A Bulthaup kitchen with oak-engineered flooring and comprising single bowl mixer tap sink unit with glass splashback, set in a worksurface with a range of soft-close cupboard and drawer units below, integrated Siemens oven and warming plate, Siemens four ring induction hob with extractor over, Siemens fridge/freezer, dishwasher, further fridge, corner carousel unit, space for dining table and chairs From the ground floor entrance hall, doors to: MAIN BEDROOM SUITE - a 'T' shaped room with maximum measurements of 19'11" x 17'9" (6.07m x 5.41m) excluding wardrobe recess - sealed-unit double-glazed windows providing superb views overlooking the central communal landscaped grounds with sea and Purbeck coastal views beyond, two contemporary Italian vertical radiators with chrome fittings, wall and ceiling light fittings, two double and one single mirror-fronted Hulsta wardrobes, four ranges of floor to ceiling fitted Hulsta bookshelving, oak-engineered flooring, feature part timber clad and beamed ceiling, fitted window blinds, wall-mounted TV bracket. Door to: EN SUITE - 6'2" x 6' (1.88m x 1.83m) - superbly styled comprising wet room style shower with recessed display shelf and shower screen, concealed cistern wc, wash hand basin with mirrored toiletry cabinet over, tiled flooring and predominantly tiled walls, underfloor heating, extractor, contemporary Italian vertical radiator with chrome fittings and towel rail attachment, recessed coving with concealed lighting BEDROOM 2 - 13'2" x 9'7" (4.01m x 2.92m) - sealed-unit double-glazed bay window with a coastal vista towards Hurst Castle Spit, contemporary Italian vertical radiator with chrome fittings, oak-engineered flooring, double and single mirror-fronted Hulsta fitted wardrobes, wall-mounted TV bracket, TV aerial point. Door to: EN SUITE - 9'10" x 5'6" (3m x 1.68m) excluding bay window - comprising wet room style shower with recessed toiletry shelf and shower screen, concealed cistern wc, vanity wash hand basin, tiled flooring, part- tiled walls, ladder-style radiator. underfloor heating, extractor, recessed coving with concealed lighting, shelved linen cupboard housing the gas-fired central heating boiler OUTSIDE: FRONT - The White House is approached from Hurst Road via automatic electric gates, with a sweeping tarmacadam driveway leading to the building, skirted by well-tended, lawned grounds and shrub borders GARAGE - in adjacent block with electric door, lighting, power sockets, PARKING, outside cold water tap, COMMUNAL BIN STORE COMMUNAL GROUNDS - extensive communal grounds, landscaped and well maintained, mainly laid to lawn with fenced, walled and shrub borders and boundaries; the landscaped CENTRAL GARDENS are laid to lawn with attractive brick pathways and low brick boundary walls, giving unrivalled, panoramic sea and coastal views with gated, direct access to the SEA FRONT with the White House sitting immediately adjacent to the seafront promenade TENURE: Shared Freehold EPC RATING: Current - D64, Potential - B87 COUNCIL TAX BAND: G MAINTENANCE: £2,200 payable per annum, to include maintenance of grounds, gates and communal lighting The White House was designed to emulate a ship's bridge, and built in 1901 by Romaine Walker, a renowned Victorian architect who also worked on other notable buildings including Chatsworth House, the Tate Gallery, Wimborne Minster and locally, Rhinefield House in Brockenhurst Milford on Sea is a thriving coastal village with a comprehensive range of restaurants, pubs and cafes plus a good range of gift and local shops including a greengrocer, butcher, fishmonger and two general stores, plus a medical centre and dental surgery, based around the village green. The Village Green is home to several events during the year, including an Arts & Music Festival, May Fair, Dog Show and Christmas Carol Service, with the Community Centre and the four village churches running busy programmes throughout the year. Walks can be enjoyed along the Coastal Path towards Barton-on-Sea and Lymington, with stunning views towards the Isle of Wight and the Needles and westwards to Christchurch Bay, Hengistbury Head and the Purbeck Hills beyond or through sheltered woodland in the Milford-on-Sea Pleasure Grounds and Studland Common, both local Nature Reserves, or around Sturt Pond and along Hurst Shingle Bank to Hurst Castle which dates back to Tudor times. The New Forest National Park is a short drive away, The New Forest became a national park in 2005 and was once a royal hunting ground for William the Conqueror. It covers an area of 566 square kilometres and is made up of vast tracts of unspoilt woodland, heathland and river valleys where deer, ponies and cattle continue to roam free in its ancient heaths and woodland. Clear rivers and shady groves provide tranquillity and a car-free haven for walking, cycling and horse riding. The towns of Lymington and New Milton are both approximately 3 miles away, with the larger shopping centres of Bournemouth and Southampton approximately equi-distant, about 18 miles away. British Rail Stations at New Milton and Brockenhurst provide a fast service to London Waterloo, with Bournemouth and Southampton airports easily accessed for domestic and international flights www.milfordonseanews.org and www.milfordonsea.org are two excellent websites providing a wealth of local information and news about the village For Council Tax information, please contact 02380 285000 or visit www.voa.gov.uk Stamp Duty charges and online calculator https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/382324/Stamp_Duty_15.pdf

A covered porch and composite door lead to the: Dining hall with double glazed UPVC square bay front aspect window. A door leads to the inner hall where the stairs rise to the first floor with further door opening to the snug which has a fitted woodburner. Understairs cupboard and double glazed UPVC side aspect window. Doors lead to both the kitchen and sitting room which is of an excellent size with a double glazed UPVC square bay front aspect and side aspect windows. There is an excellent fitted kitchen/breakfast room with plenty of room for table and chairs. Built-in split level oven, four ring gas hob unit with extractor in canopy above. Suitable space for microwave. Central heating boiler in one of the cupboards. Ample drawers and cupboards with pull out baskets and sink unit with double glazed UPVC window overlooking the garden with in addition double glazed UPVC double doors opening to the patio. A door from the kitchen gives access to the utility room where there is space and plumbing for automatic washing machine and tumble dryer with built-in single bowl single drainer stainless steel sink unit. Double glazed UPVC window and door to side of property with further door to the cloakroom. The cloakroom comprises a low level w.c. and wash hand basin. First floor landing gives access to all the bedrooms with the main bedroom at the back with double glazed UPVC window overlooking the garden with door to en suite bathroom with bath, wash hand basin, low level w.c. and shower cubicle. Double glazed obscure UPVC rear aspect window. Bedroom two is of a triple size with built-in wardrobe and double glazed front aspect window. Bedroom three is at the front of the property, again a good double with double glazed UPVC front aspect window. Bedroom four is currently used as a study and bedroom and would easily make a small double. There is a bathroom with shower unit over the bath, wash hand basin and low level w.c. with side aspect window. Outside, well planted frontage with picket fence. Driveway leads up to and along side the property eventually to the single garage. The rear garden is a most pleasant feature of the property with a patio immediately to the rear with steps up to areas of lawn. There are shrubs and bushes, pergola, greenhouse and good sized shed. EPC RATING: Current ~ TBC Potential ~ TBC COUNCIL TAX BAND: F SERVICES: Mains water, electricity, gas and drainage. HEATING: Gas fired central heating. BROADBAND: Up to 1000 mbps download (Ofcom).

displayAddress: Barton on Sea, New Milton, Hampshire
detailedDescription: Attractive covered entrance, hardwood front door to: Spacious Reception Hall Exposed wood flooring, bespoke cast iron radiator. Cloakroom Comprising corner wash hand basin, low level w.c., window to side. Sitting Room 18'10" x 14'3" (5.74m x 4.34m) Attractive recessed brick fireplace with log burning stove, exposed wood flooring, window to front. Dining Room 12'1" x 12' (3.68m x 3.66m) Exposed wood flooring, through to: Garden Room 10' x 9'10" (3.05m x 3m) Tiled flooring, radiator, windows and double opening casement doors to the rear garden. Kitchen 15'9" (4.8) x 12'1" (3.68) narrowing to 7'4" (2.24) Being part tiled comprising bowl and a half single drainer sink unit with spray mixer tap, granite work surface with abundance of soft close drawers and cupboards below, Rangemaster five ring gas hob range cooker with extractor over, range of matching wall mounted units, space for American style fridge/freezer, integrated Miele dishwasher, tiled flooring, walk in larder cupboard, window to rear, door to: Utility Room 8'10" x 3'10" (2.7m x 1.17m) Fitted Samsung washing machine with Hoover dryer over, personal door to garage, further door to: Study/Home Office 11' x 9'7" (3.35m x 2.92m) Windows overlooking rear garden, double opening casement doors. Stairs from reception hall lead to: First Floor Landing Exposed wood flooring, hatch to loft space with ladder providing excellent storage, built in linen cupboard. Entering through a bright and welcoming hallway, the home flows effortlessly into generously proportioned living spaces. The dual-aspect living room is bathed in natural light, featuring full-height glazing and French doors opening directly to the west-facing patio and garden. The impressive open-plan kitchen/dining room is fitted with sleek handleless cabinetry, quartz worktops Large windows and bi folding doors ensure a bright, airy environment, ideal for both daily living and entertaining. The kitchen is equipped with a full range of premium NEFF integrated appliances, including: • Built-in double oven with modern touch-control interface • Induction hob for fast, efficient and precise cooking • Integrated dishwasher • Integrated washer/dryer • Tall integrated fridge-freezer • Larder-style pantry cupboard There are three generous double bedrooms, all finished in soft neutral tones. The principal bedroom benefits from a stylish en-suite shower room with a large glazed shower enclosure, modern tiling, chrome fixtures and an LED-lit mirror unit. The remaining bedrooms are served by a spacious family bathroom, featuring a quality shower-bath combination, contemporary tiling and a heated towel rail. The property features a high-efficiency Worcester Bosch boiler and a Solax Power photovoltaic inverter connected to the roof-mounted solar panels and is a key contributor to the property’s impressive A-rated performance. Outside The rear of the property enjoys a private, west-facing garden which is mostly laid to lawn and bordered by new close-board fencing and brick walling. A full-width patio creates the perfect space for outdoor dining and relaxation. A brand-new timber shed provides useful garden storage. To the front, a block paviour driveway offers off-road parking, with pretty shrub bordered lawn area. EPC RATING: Current ~ A (Draft) COUNCIL TAX BAND: TBC SERVICES: Mains water, electricity, gas and drainage. HEATING: Gas fired central heating. BROADBAND: Ultrafast up to 1000 mbps download (Ofcom).

A bright and spacious hallway with wood-effect flooring, recessed lighting an gives immediate access to the principal rooms. The hallway offers an impressive sightline through to the kitchen/dining room and garden beyond. A beautifully styled sitting room enjoying excellent natural light from a large bay window to the front and French doors to the garden. The sitting room also benefits from a feature wall with inset contemporary fireplace with electric fire. The Kitchen/Dining Room is the heart of the home, a stunning open-plan space stretching across the rear of the house and connecting seamlessly to the garden through stunning bi-fold doors. The key features of the kitchen are the shaker style cabinetry with solid wood worktops, metro tile splashbacks with under cabinet lighting and space for a central island with breakfast bar (can be left by the vendors via further negotiation). There is excellent space for a dining table with multiple windows flooding the space with natural light, the flooring throughout is travertine stone and integrated appliances include, seven ring range style STOVES cooker with large extractor over, Hotpoint dishwasher, Beko washer/dryer and space for American style fridge freezer. Bedroom two (Ground Floor Double) A large, beautifully decorated room enjoying a private outlook. Ideal as a main bedroom or guest suite. Bedroom three (Ground Floor Double) A flexible room currently used as a TV snug, equally suited as a guest bedroom, home office or hobby space. Luxury Bathroom A statement bathroom featuring a freestanding contemporary bathtub, large walk-in shower enclosure, modern vanity with storage, stylish floor tiles, twin windows creating superb natural light. This downstairs bathroom has been finished to an exceptional standard. Cloakroom A stylish, modern ground-floor WC with feature lighting. First Floor Landing A bright upstairs landing giving access to principal bedroom, shower room and walk in wardrobe. Primary Bedroom Suite A charming, peaceful retreat with: two large Velux windows, stylish feature wall, and space for dressing table with seating, this is a light and airy bedroom. Shower Room A contemporary en-suite with Large walk-in shower, vanity unit, patterned tiled flooring and Velux window providing excellent natural light. Dressing Room: A superb addition: a walk-in wardrobe with built-in cupboards, hanging rails and eaves storage. Extremely practical and well-designed. Outside Landscaped Rear Garden The garden has been carefully laid out to offer multiple seating and entertaining spaces with excellent privacy. Features include: • Expansive porcelain tiled terrace with dedicated dining and lounge areas • Pergola-covered seating zone with festoon lighting • Sun loungers terrace and side relaxation area • Neatly maintained lawn with stepping-stone pathway • Mature planting, raised borders and an array of shrubs and seasonal colour • Attractive perimeter screening for enhanced privacy A superb outdoor space ideal for summer entertaining or peaceful relaxation. Garden Room / Summerhouse Set at the rear of the garden is a charming timber garden room/summerhouse. Set behind mature hedging, the property enjoys excellent privacy from the road. A wide gravel driveway provides generous parking for multiple vehicles, framed by established shrubs and planting. A paved pathway leads to the attractive oak front door, with a welcoming landscaped frontage featuring well-kept flowerbeds, bird feeders, and soft lighting this gives the home a warm, inviting first impression. A motorised electric gate slides open to give you access to driveway with carport providing off road parking and access to the attached double garage giving more space for vehicles or storage. A solid wood front door leads to entrance hallway which is tiled and leads to conservatory with fitted blinds and double opening patio doors. The inner hallway provides access to downstairs cloakroom which is fully tiled. Opposite this you find the door to the double garage which has space and plumbing for washing machine and tumble drier and wall mounted Potterton gas fired central heating boiler. The double garage benefits from an electric up and over door. An archway from the inner hallway leads to the hub of the property with a fantastic open plan style kitchen/living/dining room, with part partitioned kitchen with lit archways overlooking living area. The kitchen boasts an impressive range of granite worktops with cupboard and drawers below and matching wall mounted units above. There is a tiled splashback and integrated applicants include Neff oven with four ring gas hob over with built in extractor fan over, eye level Bosch microwave, Neff dishwasher, and under counter fridge. The room opens up beautifully through to the dining room which then gently steps down into the living area which boasts double aspects with stain glass windows to side aspect and two large sliding patio doors to the rear garden. These along with the six Velux windows provide a superb abundance of light into this area with views over the rear courtyard garden. Stairs from the inner hallway lead to the first floor landing with window overlooking side aspect. There is an airing cupboard with hot water cylinder and slatted shelving. The principal bedroom is and impressive size and boasts en suite shower room, wooden panelling and interior balcony with parquet flooring. Bedroom two is a good sized double room with wood panelling and also benefits from an en suite shower room and bedroom three also has wood panelling and is a double bedroom with aspect to the rear garden. The main bathroom completes the upstairs accommodation with obscure window to side aspect. The courtyard garden has been superbly planted out with an array of mature shrubs plants and trees. It is laid to patio for ease of maintenance and provides an excellent alfresco dining/entertaining area. There is side access to one side and a rear gate that takes you through a shortcut to the Lymington road EPC RATING: Current ~ D62 Potential ~ C74 COUNCIL TAX BAND: F SERVICES: Mains water, electricity, gas and drainage. HEATING: Gas fired central heating. BROADBAND: Ultrafast up to 900mbps download (Ofcom).

(signposted to Keyhaven and Hurst Castle), which after a short distance becomes Keyhaven Road and No.16 is on the right hand side MILFORD AND THE LOCAL AREA Milford on Sea is a thriving coastal village with a comprehensive range of restaurants, pubs and cafes plus a good range of gift and local shops including a greengrocers, butchers, fishmonger and two general stores, plus a medical centre and dental surgery, based around the village green. The Village Green is home to several events during the year, including an Arts & Music Festival, May Fair, Dog Show and Christmas Carol Service, with the Community Centre and the four village churches running busy programmes throughout the year. Walks can be enjoyed along the Coastal Path towards Barton-on-Sea and Lymington, with stunning views towards the Isle of Wight and the Needles and westwards to Christchurch Bay, Hengistbury Head and the Purbeck Hills beyond or through sheltered woodland in the Milford-on-Sea Pleasure Grounds and Studland Common, both local Nature Reserves, or around Sturt Pond and along Hurst Shingle Bank to Hurst Castle which dates back to Tudor times. The New Forest National Park is a short drive away, The New Forest became a national park in 2005 and was once a royal hunting ground for William the Conqueror. It covers an area of 566 square kilometres and is made up of vast tracts of unspoilt woodland, heathland and river valleys where deer, ponies and cattle continue to roam free in its ancient heaths and woodland. Clear rivers and shady groves provide tranquillity and a car-free haven for walking, cycling and horse riding. The towns of Lymington and New Milton are both approximately 3 miles away, with the larger shopping centres of Bournemouth and Southampton approximately equi-distant, about 18 miles away. British Rail Stations at New Milton and Brockenhurst provide a fast service to London Waterloo, with Bournemouth and Southampton airports easily accessed for domestic and international flights www.milfordonseanews.org and www.milfordonsea.org are two excellent websites providing a wealth of local information and news about the village

Take the first right into Kivernell Road, second right into Woodland Way, then immediately right into Kivernell Place and No.2 is straight ahead of you MILFORD AND THE SURROUNDING AREA Milford on Sea is a thriving coastal village with a comprehensive range of restaurants, pubs and cafes plus a good range of gift and local shops including a greengrocers, butchers and two general stores, plus a medical centre and dental surgery, based around the village green. The Village Green is home to several events during the year, including an Arts & Music Festival, May Fair, Dog Show and Christmas Carol Service, with the Community Centre and the four village churches running busy programmes throughout the year. Walks can be enjoyed along the Coastal Path towards Barton-on-Sea and Lymington, with stunning views towards the Isle of Wight and the Needles and westwards to Christchurch Bay, Hengistbury Head and the Purbeck Hills beyond or through sheltered woodland in the Milford-on-Sea Pleasure Grounds and Studland Common, both local Nature Reserves, or around Sturt Pond and along Hurst Shingle Bank to Hurst Castle which dates back to Tudor times. The New Forest National Park is a short drive away, The New Forest became a national park in 2005 and was once a royal hunting ground for William the Conqueror. It covers an area of 566 square kilometres and is made up of vast tracts of unspoilt woodland, heathland and river valleys where deer, ponies and cattle continue to roam free in its ancient heaths and woodland. Clear rivers and shady groves provide tranquillity and a car-free haven for walking, cycling and horse riding. The towns of Lymington and New Milton are both approximately 3 miles away, with the larger shopping centres of Bournemouth and Southampton approximately equi-distant, about 18 miles away. National Rail Stations at New Milton and Brockenhurst provide a fast service to London Waterloo, with Bournemouth and Southampton airports easily accessed for domestic and international flights. www.visitmilfordonsea.co.uk and www.milfordonsea.org are two excellent websites providing a wealth of local information and news about the village Stamp Duty charges and online calculator- www.gov.uk/stamp-duty-land-tax/residential-property-rates

To enter the property a porch canopy leads to composite front door with obscure glazing which leads into impressive spacious entrance hallway with spacious understairs area. This beautifully presented open-plan living space combines contemporary style with a warm, homely atmosphere. The room seamlessly integrates a modern kitchen, dining area, and comfortable lounge, creating an inviting setting ideal for both relaxing and entertaining. This area benefits from bright triple aspects and stunning bi-folding doors which lead to the garden. The kitchen features sleek light grey cabinetry and integrated appliances include dishwasher, fridge freezer, four ring electric hob with extractor oven and oven/grill below. A convenient breakfast bar creates a perfect casual dining spot. Luxury rigid vinyl flooring runs throughout this space and throughout the entirety of the ground floor accommodation. The utility room is accessed via a door from the kitchen area and boasts plenty of storage cupboards (one housing Worcester gas fired central heating boiler), worktop, large window overlooking rear aspect, door to side aspect and an integral washing machine. The ground floor bedroom is an impressive double bedroom with window overlooking front aspect. A turned staircase with glass balustrades leads to the well proportioned first floor landing has natural light flooding in via a large velux window. The principal bedroom is an impressive size and boasts beautifully bright double aspect windows overlooking side and front aspects. Bedroom two is a good size double bedroom with windows overlooking front aspect. The double aspect main bathroom boasts contemporary tiled floor, large corner shower cubicle with rainfall shower, further handheld shower, contemporary tiled walls and matching inset bath with mixer tap. There is also wall mounted shaving point and extractor fan. The south facing garden is laid to patio with external lighting and artificial lawn for ease of maintenance with the patio giving a superb space for alfresco dining/entertaining. Lighting over the back door. The garden is well enclosed by walling and contemporary trellis designs. The tasteful planted borders and decorative planters give ample space for shrubs and plants. To the front of the property is a brick paviour driveway providing good off road parking which is also well enclosed by wood panel fencing and double opening wooden gates providing good security and privacy. There is a port for an electric charging point on the side of the house to the front. Important Property Note: The property was newly built and completed in 2022 by the current vendor and benefits from triple glazed windows, underfloor zoned heating with separate thermostats in each room, and a latent defect structural warranty. EPC RATING: Current ~ B85 Potential ~ A94 COUNCIL TAX BAND: E SERVICES: Mains water, electricity, gas and drainage. HEATING: Gas fired central heating. BROADBAND: Ultrafast up to 1000 mbps download. (Ofcom)

Wooden glazed front door leads to good sized entrance hallway giving access to all rooms with a separate coats, storage and airing cupboards. A good sized living/dining area with front to back aspect overlooks the well-established gardens. The kitchen houses the Glow-worm boiler and has aspects to the rear south facing garden with patio door. There are three double bedrooms, a shower room with fully tiled walls and a separate cloakroom. The gardens are a real feature of the property being well established. There are three storage sheds and a greenhouse. To the front of the property a five bar gate leads down the gravel driveway to carport and further parking areas. Mature shrub and trees border the front creating a wonderfully private garden to all aspects. The end of Adlams lane leads into the open forest making it a perfect location for those beautiful countryside walks whilst still being within close proximity to the village of sway and the amenities it has to offer. EPC RATING: Current ~ F30 Potential ~ B83 COUNCIL TAX: E SERVICES: Mains water, electricity, gas and drainage HEATING: None BROADBAND: Ultrafast up to 1000 mbps download (Ofcom)

You approach the property via a tarmac driveway with paved pathway leading to an attractive wooden double glazed front door. This leads into the bright entrance hallway with large double glazed windows to side aspect and double opening doors open into good sized storage/coats cupboard. A further double glazed wooden door leads into the impressive dining room with an abundance of light flowing through from internal bi folding doors and window overlooking front aspect. The bi fold doors lead into the sitting room which maintains beautifully bright aspects and overlooks the rear garden. The living room benefits from Moduleo flooring throughout. An opening leads through to the garden room with stunning skylight an abundance of windows overlooking the garden with double opening patio doors leading to the patio/garden. The Moduleo flooring continues through into this room. The garden room is a thoughtful extension by the current vendors and offers a second sitting area with pleasant views of the rear garden. From the sitting room a glazed wooden door leads to the modernised kitchen/breakfast room which benefits from Karndean flooring. The Wren kitchen has an abundance of white quartz worktops with soft close drawers and cupboards and matching wall mounted units. There are beautiful double aspects to side and rear with door leading to garden. Integrated appliances include four ring electric hob, AEG extractor over and Neff oven and grill underneath, AEG fridge freezer, Neff washing machine and full size dishwasher. There are ample undercounter lights and breakfast bar providing informal dining for two. A doorway leads into inner hallway which gives access to downstairs cloakroom with extractor fan and obscure window to side aspect. To complete the ground floor accommodation is bedroom five (previously the garage) which is currently being used as a hobbies room, whilst benefiting from a small area of loft storage space (currently sealed) with window overlooking front aspect. These two rooms also benefit from Karndean flooring throughout. Stairs from the dining room lead to the first floor landing with hatch to loft space and airing cupboard housing gas fired central heating boiler. The principal bedroom is an excellent size with three windows providing beautifully light aspects to front and side overlooking the village green to the side. A door leads to the recently modernised en suite shower room with large corner shower cubicle being beautifully tiled and also benefiting from dual wash hand basins with ample vanity unit space below. Obscure windows overlook the rear aspect and there is an also an extractor fan. There are three other bedrooms on the first floor two of which are good sized double rooms and bedroom four is a single room which is currently being used as a home office with built in cupboard. The modernised main bathroom serves the three other bedrooms on this level and has fully tiled walls with bath and rainfall shower over with obscure windows overlooking rear aspect, extractor and LED illuminated mirror. The rear garden is south west facing and has been beautifully maintained by the current vendors and has two areas of patio stretching from the rear of the house to the rear of the garden providing excellent opportunity for alfresco entertaining/dining. It also keeps the garden low maintenance with a manageable area of lawn, shrub and flower borders and large timber storage shed. The rear garden benefits from good privacy and is enclosed via wood panel fencing. A large side access with picket wooden gate leads to the front of the property where the driveway is located which provides good off road parking for two cars and a further area of lawn with shrub borders. EPC RATING: Current ~ C76 Potential ~ C80 COUNCIL TAX BAND: E SERVICES: Mains water, electricity, gas and drainage. HEATING: Gas fired central heating. BROADBAND: Ultrafast up to 1000 mbps download (Ofcom).

A glazed door with matching side panels lead into an entrance porch with tiled flooring and large floor to ceiling window overlooking side aspect which lets lots of light through to the entrance porch and hallway. A wooden obscure glazed door with matching side panel leads to the entrance hallway which is of good size with window overlooking side aspect, large coats cupboard, understairs storage cupboard and door leading to downstairs cloakroom. The living room is an impressive size with front to back aspect windows looking out onto private gardens. A wooden glazed door with matching side panel leads into the dining room with sliding patio door which leads to the rear gardens. You can also access the dining room via the entrance hallway. The kitchen comprises a good range of cupboards and drawers with roll edge worktops. There is a tiled splashback, hatch to dining room and large window overlooking rear gardens. There is further space for gas oven, slimline dishwasher and fridge freezer. A door opens to the Side lobby which is handy for storage with doors leading to the rear and front of the property and also leads through to the attached garage with electric up and over door, power lighting, space and plumbing for washing machine and tumble-drier. The wall mounted gas fired Worcester Bosch boiler is located here as is the consumer unit. Stairs from the entrance hallway lead to the first floor galleried landing with an impressive window overlooking the front aspects and letting plenty of light flow through to the upstairs space. The first floor landing benefits from storage cupboard airing cupboard and hatch to loft space. There are four well-proportioned double bedrooms three of which benefit from built in wardrobes with one having a good sized en suite shower room. The main bathroom completes the first floor accommodation and is a good size with obscure window to rear aspect. The house is bright and light throughout and flows very well whilst still having the potential to modernise. The south facing rear garden has a lovely patio terrace running across the back of the house with an area of tiered lawn below. There is a further raised bed with mixed pots and the remainder of the garden is made up with an array of mature shrub and flowers with hedging and fencing to the rear and side giving a good degree of privacy. A large side access houses shed and double opening gates lead to the front garden which extends all the way down on one side giving extra space at the front. The driveway provides good off road parking with Lawned area and shrub and tree borders.

The front of the property accessed from Frys Lane with a good sized tarmacadam driveway with parking for several vehicles leading to the front of the property EPC RATING: 66D COUNCIL TAX BAND: F TENURE: Freehold DIRECTIONAL NOTE: From the village green in the centre of Milford-on-Sea, proceed out of the village in a northerly direction on the B3058 Lymington Road. On reaching the junction with the A337 Lymington/Christchurch road, turn left and after a very short distance, turn right into Everton Road (signed to Everton and Hordle), and take the second right into Frys Lane where the property will be seen on the left hand side and is numbered EVERTON AND THE SURROUNDING AREA Everton is a popular, pleasant village, enjoying a strong community spirit and with the benefit of a comprehensive post office/village store, church, social club, recreation ground with children's play area plus a village pub/restaurant. The coastal village of Milford-on-Sea is 1.5 miles away with a good selection of shops, pubs and restaurants. Milford on Sea is a thriving coastal village with a comprehensive range of restaurants, pubs and cafes plus a good range of gift and local shops including a greengrocers, butchers and two general stores, plus a medical centre and dental surgery, based around the village green. The Village Green is home to several events during the year, including an Arts & Music Festival, May Fair, Dog Show and Christmas Carol Service, with the Community Centre and the four village churches running busy programmes throughout the year. Walks can be enjoyed along the Coastal Path towards Barton-on-Sea and Lymington, with stunning views towards the Isle of Wight and the Needles and westwards to Christchurch Bay, Hengistbury Head and the Purbeck Hills beyond or through sheltered woodland in the Milford-on-Sea Pleasure Grounds and Studland Common, both local Nature Reserves, or around Sturt Pond and along Hurst Shingle Bank to Hurst Castle which dates back to Tudor times. The New Forest National Park, a short drive away, became a national park in 2005 and was once a royal hunting ground for William the Conqueror. It covers an area of 566 square kilometres and is made up of vast tracts of unspoilt woodland, heathland and river valleys where deer, ponies and cattle continue to roam free in its ancient heaths and woodland. Clear rivers and shady groves provide tranquillity and a car-free haven for walking, cycling and horse riding. The towns of Lymington and New Milton are both approximately 3 miles away, with the larger shopping centres of Bournemouth and Southampton approximately equi-distant, about 18 miles away. National Rail Stations at New Milton and Brockenhurst provide a fast service to London Waterloo, with Bournemouth and Southampton airports easily accessed for domestic and international flights. www.visitmilfordonsea.co.uk and www.milfordonsea.org are two excellent websites providing a wealth of local information and news about the village Stamp Duty charges and online calculator- www.gov.uk/stamp-duty-land-tax/residential-property-rates

displayAddress: Barton On Sea, New Milton, Hampshire
detailedDescription: Covered entrance porch leading to part double glazed entrance door with matching side screen leading to: Entrance Porch Leading through to: Entrance Hallway Wood effect flooring, sky-tubes, sliding door to kitchen/dining/family room and further door to: Separate WC Comprising low level dual flush w.c., wash hand basin with tiled splashback and cupboard below, obscure double glazed window to side aspect, extractor fan. Outside The property is approached via an in and out tarmac driveway providing excellent off road parking with further area of shingle and lawn to the side, providing extra parking space for boat/motorhome. The front garden is mainly laid for ease of maintenance with low level wall boundary, enclosed by fencing. The garden benefits from an excellent degree of privacy with outside power points. Office/Cabin 16'8" x 10'7" (5.08m x 3.23m) Located to the rear of the garden, power and lighting, double glazed sliding patio doors overlooking the garden. Door through to storage area.

You approach the property via a covered porch with matching oak posts and brick paviour steps which lead to an feature, glazed oak front door with lead light side panel windows. This opens up to the entrance hallway with fitted good sized coat/shoes cupboard. It boasts engineered oak flooring and a ledge and brace wooden door leads into the hub of the property which is the very spacious kitchen/family/dining room. This room benefits from engineered oak flooring with triple aspects and is light and bright throughout. There is a good array of wood and quartz worktops and quality wood-fronted baseline cupboards, perfect for the keen cook. A breakfast bar creates an informal dining / working space. Integrated appliances include Rangemaster cooker and Neff dishwasher. There is also space for an upright fridge freezer and further under counter fridge as well as a cupboard housing Worcester Bosch gas fired central heating boiler. There is a hatch for loft storage in this room, and a wooden and glazed stable door opens onto a small courtyard. Bespoke double wooden and glazed doors lead into an extensive walk in pantry cupboard with further storage beyond. An opening from the kitchen/family/dining room leads to the newly refurbished, light and airy sitting room fitted with underfloor heating, stunning new bi-folding doors overlooking the rear garden. There is space and plumbing for washing machine and tumble drier. A door then leads into a spacious new luxury shower room with large shower cubicle, bespoke sink unit, large upright towel radiator and window overlooking rear aspect. From the entrance hallway, another a ledge and brace wooden door leads to the well-proportioned downstairs bedroom with dual aspects, beams and beautiful feature open fireplace. Stairs from the entrance hallway lead to the first floor landing which has a Velux window providing natural light. There is also a hatch to the main loft space. The principal double bedroom benefits from triple aspect windows including a front to back aspect, creating a wonderfully light room with plenty of fitted wardrobe space and hidden shelving. The room has attractive sloping ceilings, wooden ledge and brace door as well as the original fireplace. The third double bedroom has a window to the front aspect, sloping ceilings, wooden ledge and brace door and original fireplace, as well as another hatch to a loft space The generous main bathroom services these two bedrooms and offers a magnificent freestanding, claw foot bath, bespoke sink unit and dual aspects including a Velux window. The property sits within an impressive plot. The west-facing rear garden is mainly laid to lawn with two apple trees, a mixture of shrubs, a small brick pot store and a greenhouse. The self-contained workshop has power, lighting and a pitched and tiled roof, providing good storage and excellent working areas. There are two gated side accesses, a log store and a large wooden storage shed with power and lighting. The rear garden boasts two apple trees, a mixture of shrubs, brick coal bunker and greenhouse. The front garden is an impressive size with hedge borders, two cherry trees and other, interspersed trees. It is mainly laid to lawn with a large driveway providing excellent off-road parking. The property is located within easy walking distance of two recreation grounds, Foxhills Pre-School, Infant and Junior Schools, a Co Op shop as well as several restaurants, take-aways and pubs. Ashurst train station and the New Forest national park can be reached in a 5-minute drive. PROPERTY NOTE: The property has planning permission granted for a first floor extension to create a fourth bedroom, details can be found at https://planning.agileapplications.co.uk/nfnpa/application-details/59707 EPC RATING: Current ~ D63 Potential ~ C69 COUNCIL TAX BAND: E SERVICES: Mains water, gas and electricity. HEATING: Gas fired central heating. BROADBAND: Ultrafast up to 500 mbps download. We understand that Truli have just installed a new fibre connection but this is not available to the property yet, but should be in the next few months.

You enter the property via a picket gate with paved pathway leading down the beautifully kept front garden mainly laid to lawn with patio seating area to the front of the house. This leads you up to the front porch with pitched roof which leads into the entrance hallway with stairs leading to the first floor. The first door on your left open into the sitting room with laminate wood flooring and feature original fireplace. There is also a sash window overlooking the front gardens and access to understairs storage cupboard. Opposite the hallway is the second reception room with feature original fireplace which currently houses a gas fire. There is a sash window overlooking front gardens. The Kitchen/Dining Room has access from both reception rooms. Integrated appliances include, Aga, Modern under counter single oven and ceramic hob with extractor fan above. There are also matching wall and floor standing cupboards and space and plumbing for dishwasher and washing machine. Further space for fridge/freezer in recess. A large window overlooks the rear gardens and a Side door gives access to the walkway to rear garden. The Dining Area has double opening patio doors which lead directly to the rear garden. The Downstairs Cloakroom completes the downstairs accommodation and houses boiler for central heating and domestic hot water. There is an obscure window to the rear aspect. Stairs from the Entrance Hallway then lead to the First Floor Landing which gives access to an airing cupboard and loft space. The principal bedroom boasts original fireplace and sash window overlooking front gardens. Bedroom two boasts original fireplace and windows overlooking front gardens. Bedroom three is a double aspect bedroom with windows to rear and side aspects. The main bathroom benefits from bath and separate shower cubicle with electric power shower and completes the first floor accommodation and services the three double bedrooms. There are also two storage cupboards and an obscure window overlooking the rear aspect. To the front of the property there is a shingle driveway providing off-road parking for two cars a gate to the side of the property leads to a pathway to the rear of the property providing rear access through a further gate. The rear garden is mainly laid to paving slabs and is enclosed by a mixture of wooden panel fencing and brick walling. There is a medium size garden shed, shingle bedding and planting, outside water tap, flood lighting and an integrated small brick built barbecue. EPC RATING: Current ~ D57 Potential ~ C77 COUNCIL TAX BAND: E SERVICES: Mains water, electricity, gas and drainage. HEATING: Gas fired central heating. BROADBAND: Ultrafast up to 1000 mbps download (Ofcom).

Garage: 18' x 7'10" (5.49m x 2.4m) Up and over door, UPVC double glazed window and door to the garden, light and power connected EPC RATINGS: Current – 64D Potential – 79C COUNCIL TAX BAND: E TENURE: Freehold AGENTS NOTE: The property has been recently repointed and now benefits from the ultra fast fibre to the door DIRECTIONAL NOTE: From the village green in the centre of Milford-on-Sea proceed in an easterly direction along the High Street towards Keyhaven and take the third turning on the right into New Lane, then take the first right into Plover Drive where No.10 will be found on the right hand side and is numbered MILFORD AND THE LOCAL AREA Milford on Sea is a thriving coastal village with a comprehensive range of restaurants, pubs and cafes plus a good range of gift and local shops including a greengrocers, butchers, fishmonger and two general stores, plus a medical centre and dental surgery, based around the village green. The Village Green is home to several events during the year, including an Arts & Music Festival, May Fair, Dog Show and Christmas Carol Service, with the Community Centre and the four village churches running busy programmes throughout the year. Walks can be enjoyed along the Coastal Path towards Barton-on-Sea and Lymington, with stunning views towards the Isle of Wight and the Needles and westwards to Christchurch Bay, Hengistbury Head and the Purbeck Hills beyond or through sheltered woodland in the Milford-on-Sea Pleasure Grounds and Studland Common, both local Nature Reserves, or around Sturt Pond and along Hurst Shingle Bank to Hurst Castle which dates back to Tudor times. The New Forest National Park is a short drive away, The New Forest became a national park in 2005 and was once a royal hunting ground for William the Conqueror. It covers an area of 566 square kilometres and is made up of vast tracts of unspoilt woodland, heathland and river valleys where deer, ponies and cattle continue to roam free in its ancient heaths and woodland. Clear rivers and shady groves provide tranquillity and a car-free haven for walking, cycling and horse riding. The towns of Lymington and New Milton are both approximately 3 miles away, with the larger shopping centres of Bournemouth and Southampton approximately equi-distant, about 18 miles away. British Rail Stations at New Milton and Brockenhurst provide a fast service to London Waterloo, with Bournemouth and Southampton airports easily accessed for domestic and international flights www.milfordonseanews.org and www.milfordonsea.org are two excellent websites providing a wealth of local information and news about the village

The property has a good sized driveway for several cars as well as a single garage with an electric door. Convenient paved ramped access to main entrance and side access to the rear garden from either side. Upon entering you will notice the flow of natural light throughout. The lounge/diner is a nice size and ties in well with the kitchen which has all the appliances you can expect including a built-in oven/grill, integrated gas hob with extractor above, and integrated fridge and freezer beneath the work surface with space/plumbing for a dishwasher. The kitchen also has ample storage cupboards both above and beneath the work surface. There is a separate utility with storage cupboards beneath work surface, with space and plumbing for a washing machine. A downstairs cloakroom and a downstairs bedroom which has built-in wardrobes and a good size ensuite with both a shower cubicle and a bath complete the ground floor. While the first floor has the main bathroom and two further bedrooms, both good sized rooms with one also having a walk in wardrobe/dressing room. The garden is nice and easy to maintain with a small lawn and mature planted borders to the side and rear boundary. COUNCIL TAX BAND: F EPC RATING: Current ~ C76 Potential ~ B86 SERVICES: Mains water, electricity, gas and drainage. HEATING: Gas fired central heating. BROADBAND: Ultrafast up to 1000 mbps download (Ofcom).

You approach the property via a tarmac driveway and front entrance door leading to a covered entrance porch, perfect for shoes and cloaks storage. An internal front door then leads to an impressive entrance hallway with parquet flooring and understairs storage cupboard. The dual front to back aspect sitting room is very spacious and benefits from a feature fireplace with brick surround. Double doors from the sitting room lead into the formal dining room with sliding patio door to conservatory and further door leading back into the entrance hallway. The kitchen/breakfast room is a well-proportioned room with large window overlooking rear aspect with door to side aspect and double garage. The integral double garage has an electric up and over door and obscure window overlooking side aspect. To complete the ground floor accommodation is the cloakroom with w.c. A turned staircase from the entrance hallway leads to the spacious first floor landing with multiple storage cupboards and airing cupboard. There are four double bedrooms all benefitting from fitted wardrobes. The main bathroom and separate shower room service the bedrooms upstairs. The rear garden faces south west and is mainly laid to lawn with an area of patio and is enclosed by wood panel fencing. The front garden is mainly laid to lawn with hedge borders and driveway providing off road parking. EPC RATING: Current ~ TBC Potential ~ TBC COUNCIL TAX BAND: G SERVICES: Mains water, electricity, gas and drainage. HEATING: Gas fired central heating. BROADBAND: Up to 1000 mbps download (Ofcom)

The New Forest National Park is a short drive away, The New Forest became a national park in 2005 and was once a royal hunting ground for William the Conqueror. It covers an area of 566 square kilometres and is made up of vast tracts of unspoilt woodland, heathland and river valleys where deer, ponies and cattle continue to roam free in its ancient heaths and woodland. Clear rivers and shady groves provide tranquillity and a car-free haven for walking, cycling and horse riding. The towns of Lymington and New Milton are both approximately 3 miles away, with the larger shopping centres of Bournemouth and Southampton approximately equi-distant, about 18 miles away. British Rail Stations at New Milton and Brockenhurst provide a fast service to London Waterloo, with Bournemouth and Southampton airports easily accessed for domestic and international flights www.milfordonseanews.org and www.milfordonsea.org are two excellent websites providing a wealth of local information and news about the village For Council Tax information, please contact 02380 285000 or visit www.voa.gov.uk

Property features: Spacious entrance hallway with herringbone parquet floor. Ground floor refitted shower room with thermostatically controlled shower. Ground floor double aspect, double bedroom. Impressive sitting/dining room. Conservatory leading to rear garden. Well fitted country style kitchen/breakfast room with integrated John Lewis double oven. Handy utility room leading to side access. Upstairs the prinicpal bedroom boasts double aspect windows and en suite bathroom. Two futher double bedrooms both with double aspects. Upstairs cloakroom. Large driveway providing excellent off road parking. Brick-built store/workshop with workbench, double aspect windows, power and lighting. Good sized private, west facing rear garden with large patio terrace perfect for alfresco entertaining/dining. Steps lead down to the lower garden which is mainly laid to lawn and houses two timber sheds. The gardens are well established with mature shrub and flower beds and the planting to the front and rear gives a great deal of privacy. The property is situated within easy walking distance of the village centre, primary school, train station and the open forest. Note The property benefits from owned solar panels TENURE: Freehold COUNCIL TAX BAND: E EPC RATING: D DIRECTIONAL NOTE: From the traffic lights in the centre of New Milton proceed in a southerly direction along Station Road. At the roundabout, take the first exit into Lymington Road, continuing along this road until reaching the village of Everton. Take the first turning left into Everton Road, continue, taking the second turning right into Frys Lane, followed by first right into Harts Way. Take the first turning left into Beacon Close, where the property can be found at the head of the cul de sac and is numbered. EVERTON AND THE SURROUNDING AREA Everton is a popular, pleasant village, enjoying a strong community spirit and with the benefit of a comprehensive post office/village store, church, social club, recreation ground with children's play area plus a village pub/restaurant. Everton is located midway between the towns of Lymington and New Milton which are only 3 miles away, and which provide easy access by British Rail to the larger shopping centre of Southampton and the seaside resort of Bournemouth, both of which have airports for domestic and international flights. The New Forest village of Brockenhurst also provides a fast train service direct to London Waterloo. In addition, Milford on Sea is approximately 1.5 miles from Everton and is a thriving coastal village boasting a long shingle beach, lined with colourful beach huts and stunning unspoilt views across the Solent. The beach is a hive of activity in the summer with windsurfers, kite surfers, kayakers and paddle boarders, and swimmers also enjoying the sandbar at low tide. This traditional village is a secret haven of character and charm with its lively centre based around the Village Green offering a first-class range of shops, restaurants, pubs and cafes, as well as local amenities including a greengrocer, butchers, fishmongers, two general stores, a medical centre and a dental surgery. The Village Green is home to several events during the year, including an Arts & Music Festival, May Fair, Dog Show and Christmas Carol Service, with the Community Centre and the four village churches running busy programmes throughout the year. Walks can be enjoyed along the sea wall towards the popular market town of Lymington and the tranquil hamlet of Keyhaven as a perfect place to stop and enjoy views towards the Isle of Wight, Hurst Castle and the Needles. The walk from Keyhaven and Milford along Hurst Spit to the castle dating back to Tudor Times, is a must. To the west you can walk to Barton-on-Sea and enjoy the views across to Christchurch Bay, Hengistbury Head and the Purbeck Hills beyond. Milford-on-Sea has beautiful walks through sheltered woodland in the local Nature Reserves of Studland Common and the Pleasure Grounds as well as Sturt Pond. The New Forest National Park, only a short drive away, covers an area of 566 square kilometres and is made up of vast tracts of unspoilt woodland, heathland and river valleys where deer, ponies and cattle continue to roam free. Clear rivers and shady groves provide tranquillity and a car-free haven for walking, cycling and horse riding.
